Review Title: Great location, roof top bar and breakfast
Negative Reviews: We probably had the worst view  from the hotel. Staff were ok. We asked 3 staff the same thing and got 3 different answers. In the end they were all wrong and we managed it by ourselves. Door staff have a difficult job working out who is staying in the hotel, but they were far from happy when you entered the hotel.
Positive Reviews: Great location. Amazing roof top bar with great views. Breakfast was excellent. Roof top bar staff were excellent.

Review Title: Good apart from the top floor bars.
Negative Reviews:
The only problem with this hotel are the top level bars with views over the city. The staff are obviously tasked with getting as many non residents into these bars as possible.
This results in chaos, as residents, we went to the upper floor bar to watch the football final only to be told we could not go in as it was full, which it clearly was not.
Only after making a fuss and asking to see the manager did a table miraculously become available.
Not good enough when I am paying to actually stay in the hotel.
For this reason alone I would not go back. There are many hotels in madrid that treat their guests with more respect than the bar staff in yhe viewing bar here. I will spend my money elsewhere.
Positive Reviews: In general the hotel was very good, most staff except the bar staff in the top floor bars were excellent. Breakfast good but very busy. Location convenient for everything.

Negative Reviews: We were looking forward to enjoying the rooftop bar and swimming pool but couldn't do either due to the crowds. As guests we felt we missed out on this opportunity which should have been part of the enjoyment of staying there. The pool was too small for the number of people wanting to play there and the roof top bar was hugely overcrowded. You could not get near the edge just to take a photo and there was no seating available to enjoy a drink 🍷. We returned to our room which was disappointing.
Positive Reviews: We loved the location, the buffet breakfast, the room size and convenience.

Negative Reviews: I asked for a crib at 10PM and it the staff took 1.5hras to brought to my room. I couldn't sleep my baby, I had to go downstairs  and stayed in the lobby until they fixed the situation, after one hour and a half of waiting.
Positive Reviews:
Location, location, location
The room was clean and the breakfast was amazing

Negative Reviews: Lack of a restaurant for dinner, other than tapas and snacks. Poor visibility of TV screen even with the curtains closed - maybe power-saving? No crispy bacon for breakfast. only barely cooked and soft.
Positive Reviews: The location was perfect. The decor was excellent. The standard of cleanliness and service was first class. The room and bathroom were super and we had a fantastic view of the Plaza de Espana, the Royal Palace and towards the cathedral. Absolutely all the staff were polite, knowledgeable and helpful. Wonderful Sky Bar.

Negative Reviews: The breakfast could have been better for the price
Positive Reviews: I loved the customer service with 2 large bags, the rooftop bar , amd the views ofntje city.  The presidential suite room was amazing!!

Negative Reviews: Rooftop bar need more people taking orders and breakfast could do with more vegan options.
Positive Reviews: great location, room was very nice, staff ever so friendly, rooftop bar absolutely amazing

Negative Reviews: It was odd just having a bath tub In the room open viewed with no privacy I would recommend either a slide sheet just for that little privacy customers may find this abit intimidating .
Positive Reviews:
Staff very helpful and friendly and attentive to your needs.
The rooms excellent worth getting the terrace 
Facilities wonderful 
Views amazing such a wonderful experience .
A tick of the bucket list haing viewed a scenic view via a transparent glass .

Negative Reviews: Room was small for the price. No seating area. Problem with credit card pre authorised system. Embarrassing as not accepted on numerous occasions and although we complained 3 times no gesture of goodwill made by staff
Positive Reviews: Excellent location   Fantastic sky top bar. Breakfast superb

Negative Reviews: Went to rooftop bar but sat for ages, no one came over to serve us so we left. Maybe change their choice of music up there and not so loud. Only other negative is that groups of people who are only going to the sky bar crowd around the lifts so you cant get to see the little screens that tell you what lift  to take to your room. Maybe have staff there to sort out instead of quite a few on the main door.
Positive Reviews: Very nice, great location, choice of food at breakfast was excellent. The only negative was the sky bar issue for us.

Negative Reviews:
The room had a significant amount of dust in the air. I don't typically have respiratory issues, but upon returning to the room, I began sneezing incessantly.

The room temperature was around 25 celsius degrees at night, and when we attempted to activate the air conditioning, it wasn't working. We asked for assistance from the staff, who informed us that the air conditioning is deactivated during the fall season. Their recommendation was to open the window; however, we encountered a limitation as the window could only be opened approximately 5cm due to some kind of lock mechanism attached to it.
Positive Reviews:
The breakfast was truly exceptional, undoubtedly one of the locations with the best options I've ever encountered. They have an entire floor dedicated to a wide range of choices, from fruits and vegetables to sausages, eggs, desserts, and more.

This hotel likely boasts one of the best locations in the city, being conveniently close to everything and featuring a metro station right at its doorstep. This means you can easily reach any part of the city in no time.

The rooftop bar offers not only fantastic food and cocktails but also a unique experience. Admission is free for hotel guests, and you can even capture a photo on the suspended glass walkway that's a part of it.

Negative Reviews: Maybe the surface of the swimming pool.
Positive Reviews: Location is perfect, the view is huge, especially from the terrace, everybody speek english(great accomplishment in Spain!), breakfast is fantastic. It was GREAT!

Negative Reviews: Elevators system, too big hotel
Positive Reviews: Location, breakfast, roof top bar

Review Title: Great, will definitely recommend to my family and friends

Great breakfast menu, good central location. I like the elevator system.

Negative Reviews: Parking is expensive and very tight to park the car. The Gym could be better for the hotel category.
Positive Reviews: The rooftop view , Breakfast with a lot of options and location very good. The restaurant /bar in the rooftop has a very nice menu and a pleasant environment.

Negative Reviews: It’s in plaza España which happens to be full and closed often due to events. Make sure to double check the agenda events if you want a quieter stay.
Positive Reviews: Great location, comfortable, breakfast amazing, lovely rooftop and bar

Review Title: Great location, beautiful hotel, highly recommend!

This hotel has the most amazing rooftop terrace bar on the 27th floor. The views of Madrid are probably the best you can get. On the Thursday night at 10 pm there were incredible street performers roaming.

Negative Reviews: the wifi only allowed to connect to 4 devices or there was a problem with my connection!
Positive Reviews: the hotel is fantastic! Breakfast was incredible and the location is perfect! and you have the rooftop bar which is the best cherry on the cake!

Negative Reviews: Would love if it had a spa.
Positive Reviews: The breakfast selection is great. The fruit was really fresh, pastries lovely and Spanish omelette was gorgeous. Location is great for both walking the city or using the metro.

Negative Reviews: Rooftop bar has limited opening hours and it was crowded.
Positive Reviews:
Nice roof top bar
Excellent location

Review Title: had the potential to be good but was a disappointment
Negative Reviews:
we paid for a delux room on 21st floor (2124) to find that the corridor to our room was a dumping ground for various service trollies/heaters etc serving the roof terrace, lots of banging and coming and going, very noisy, going on past our bedtime.  
further cistern in our bathroom kept running, that noise was a further disturbance.  reported it but it was not fixed.
so these issues made the stay disappointing, along with a closed pool.
Positive Reviews: central, in theory good facilities, but not open, good choice at breakfast
Room Type: Deluxe Superior King Room with Terrace

Review Title: Brilliant location and good Madrid style.
Negative Reviews: We had a room with a window to the inner courtyard so it was dark - probably a matter of offer and price. The staff said the pool (bath size more) was still closed in May but other guests were using it. The hotel is big so it is crowded and there is a long wait for the lift. The large bathroom would have accommodated a bidet but there wasn't one.
Positive Reviews: The location is brilliant, the very centre of Madrid and everywhere is close and the metro is at the door. The hotel has its own style and reputation. Breakfast was excellent, plentiful, tasty. The viewing terrace and bar even attracted customers from outside the hotel.

Negative Reviews: No decent coffee in room. Airconditioning was poor. Heard the same complaint from another guest, had to open windows to try cool room down. Deposit taken for additional charges then was not able to pay for room service on the room. Cash or card only, not sure the point of placing the additional deposit. The room service could not deliver any hot drinks, not even a coffee/cappachino? I was told to ask reception who said they cant help apart from coffee granules.
Positive Reviews: Location, views. Excellent breakfast. Staff professional and polite in general.

Review Title: Great hotel for a weekend in Madrid
Negative Reviews: I had an issue with the outsourced room service dinner, but the hotel staff was very responsive and resolved it quickly. Great support and service from the front desk team.
Positive Reviews:
Great hotel. Very well located in the center of Madrid. 
Good breakfast and staff is great.

Negative Reviews: I would extend the number of hours given for breakfast.
Positive Reviews: The variety in the breakfast. The staff was very polite. How modern it was, the location.

Negative Reviews: Lift waiting times for breakfast however this is to be expected
Positive Reviews: Great food choice, excellent views, staff were really friendly and accommodating! Over all great experience and value for money!

Positive Reviews: Great location, service was good and food was  good.

Negative Reviews: This hotel would have been 5 stars all round if it wasn’t for the 26th & 27th floor - the restaurant and roof top bar. We went up on 3 occasions and had 3 bad experiences. The bar staff were nice but the bar is incredibly busy with people from outside the hotel paying to see the view and queuing for photos. Our experience in the Eden restaurant was awful, went in around 18:00 for dinner with no reservation - we were told there was no window seats available which was annoying but we sat down anyway, waited 15 minutes to get a drink order taken in an almost empty restaurant before we walked out. Most annoying part was that there was so many window seats available, no reason for us not to be seated near the view.
Positive Reviews: Excellent room, size and comfort, we were lucky and got a room facing the square which was great for people watching. Breakfast was brilliant, plenty seating and lovely view of the square if you got a window seat. Location is ideal! Reception staff and door staff always friendly and smiling. Cleaners always did a great job too!

breakfast: at 7 am a lot of people waitin for the breakfast, very crowded. There are options but if you want a cake, there isn't, if you want a cookies, there aren't cookies, the food repeat a lot.

room: doble room in a small space, impossible to open my lugages. The bathroom very small for two people mantain your things for 5 days.

Elevators: fullllllll, long time waiting , a disaster, I needed time to arrive in the reception

Service: men in the recetion aren't polite , when you arrive they asked : where are you coming ? I 'm here , I `m in the hotel, and after my answer, ok. But there are a lot of people go in and go out in the hotel, dificult to control.

I waited to arrive in the room and find a chocolate, confortable shoes or something " tender" for the guests but no. Riu is very famous, I was frustrade. I travel every week and stayed in many simple hotel much better than Riu.

Review Title: Could have been so much better!
Negative Reviews:
Some of the staff were unpleasant and rude, which unfortunately left our group feeling very disappointed with our stay. Housekeeping were lovely, always greeted you with a smile, as were the staff in the restaurant for breakfast along with the porters storing the luggage. They were probably the nicest. 
Unfortunately the bar manager in the Sky Bar, some of the bar staff and the manager in the lobby bar were vile and rude. In the Sky Bar, she stood staring at us until we had finished our drinks, despite it being another 30 minutes until the bar closed. In my opinion we were having a great time, giggling and chatting, but not being obnoxious so the response was ridiculous. When we left she then appeared at the lifts and waited until we got in. I’m not sure what she thought we were going to do. We are a group of women in our 40s! 
The following day on departure we sat in the lobby bar with a few drinks and snacks from the bar. My friend grabbed a bag of crisps out of her bag to eat and the manager shouted no and pointed! A simple oh sorry you can’t eat your own food in here would have been sufficient. Being spoken to like naughty children was not the parting memory we wanted! 
I wouldn’t stay here again, which is a real shame as as the hotel is lovely but the staff need some training in manners and attitude.
Positive Reviews: The location was fantastic and the faculties were great, such as the pool, rooftop bar and restaurant (breakfast)

Negative Reviews:
Some few cases excluded, this hotel has a serious problem with staff: they really struggle with English (unacceptable in a city like Madrid and in a structure like this one) and there has been some episodes really unacceptable. We booked 4 rooms, when we arrive in the morning they told us that just one room was ready (totally fine). We decided to go to the rooftop to meet other 2 people who where in Madrid but non staying with us. There can be just one guest per room, the other guy needed to pay to access the rooftop even if we told them that we were waiting for other 3 rooms (already completely payed btw). Next evening we went back there with the same 2 people (and with 4 rooms), they unpolitely told us we cannot go up, we argue and just after our resistance an other guy arrived and let us enter. When we reached the bar they told us no table service was done, we ordered to drink anyway and got our beverages to our table one by one (meanwhile at least 5 waitresses were placidly looking at us), then after 10 minutes one of them came to tell that we had 20 minutes to finish because they were closing.
UNACCEPTABLE

Review Title: Really good hotel , remember it’s a big place , use the safe (!) and location is perfect .
Negative Reviews:
1.Breakfast  food is great but it’s so busy it’s like being at a football stadium trying to get into the ground . Great if you like that but was too busy for us .
2.Hotel is big - so felt a bit impersonal but nothing wrong with that .
3. We aren’t disabled but we’re given a disabled room . The toilet flush didn’t reach the front of the bowl so didn’t remove any debris which is a bit of a design flaw.
4. Finally and most annoyingly ( we did ring and mention this) we forgot to put a bag of change which we use for tips for the staff in the safe and this was removed on the second to last day we were there . So suggest using safe is a good idea !

Negative Reviews:
The outside pool was closed on day 2. We choose this hotel because of the outside pool. Specifically because we were here only the weekend with knowing it is very hot in Madrid in summer. We planned our afternoon to be at the pool. When we arrived it was closed for a private event or something. No warnings upon booking, no warnings that day or what so ever. 
The first day the pool was open (they could have put a sign there to inform the guests maybe?) but the drinks at the pool are seriously overpriced and not good. The bar tender had no idea how to make our cocktails (was checking some notes the whole time) and the sangria was not good. He started to make the Sangria with Amaretto.

Negative Reviews: The Breakfast Buffet, GYM, Sky deck
Positive Reviews: The Breakfast Buffet, GYM & the location

Negative Reviews:
There's a little too much technology to learn up front when you arrive here 
you have to learn how to work the elevators and at times it seemed to put a few too many people in at once
you are assigned a User ID and password to log into WIFI and then you have to change the password - I'm not sure why this is necessary - this is the only hotel where I have ever seen this required 
then you are suggested to download their app for better access to services, then a suggestion you become a member of their loyalty plan   
there's a light in the bathroom that comes on and shuts off automatically and I never did figure out how to stop this as it simply didn't make sense as to why or when it was coming on 
Also, there's a very modern looking, stylish drain in the shower, but it simply didn't drain fast enough so I was left standing in soapy water until it drains out
Positive Reviews:
The bed was fantastic - very large and comfortable 
The terrace on the 27th floor is spectacular and is really a tourist attraction in itself 
Excellent breakfast - all the Spanish classics are available 
Wifi is very strong and fast 
Everything very modern 
Lots of staff around to answer questions

Negative Reviews: We had to go home.......
Positive Reviews: From the moment we walked into the lobby to the time of check out we were treated to top notch professionalism, courtesy and kindness. Well staffed, so that there was always someone to help/guide you. Our room was large with plenty of storage and amenities. Safe didn't work and was immediately addressed as was the clog in the sink before we even had a chance to unpack. Breakfast exceeded our expectations. Variety and quality of food was amazing. The entire hotel was run like a well oiled machine. Will recommend to anyone and everyone!!

Review Title: Well located for weekend break & excellent value for money
Negative Reviews:
The pool wasn't open in May even though it was +25 degree.
Lifts had a central calling system but we seemed to a have to wait a long time for them
Positive Reviews:
Large, clean and well-appointed room (Superior deluxe) and bathroom overlooking Plaza Espana. The bed and pillows were comfortable. Tea and coffee facilities were available. The room had a minimalist feel to it, but was high-end and well maintained and comfortable. 
The breakfast was comprehensive - lots of choices including hot breakfast. It was only here that we appreciated the full size of the hotel. It's huge but the service and atmosphere did not suffer because of that.
The hotel has an excellent rooftop terrace and bar on 27th floor - much higher than many other buildings around the plaza. This is open to the public. There is a decent tapas-style restaurant on 26th floor. We found this a bit more expensive compared to other restaurants in Madrid. 
There is a metro stop about 50 metres from the hotel. The hop-on-hop off bus stops right outside every 15 mins and the 001 free bus to Atcoha station goes from the other side of the road. It's about 10 mins walk to the Palace but we seemed to be able to get to most places on foot within 30 mins. 
Would definitely stay again. We felt this was good value for money too

room was gorgeous and cleaned every day whilst on our 4 day trip. 
air con was an absolute dream and life saver 
the restaurant and rooftop sky bar is amazing also

Negative Reviews: I have no complaints
Positive Reviews: Exceptionally clean. Very efficient. Elevator system was excellent. Breakfast lovely, great choices. Very well run. Staff were so nice. Sebastian at check in was very nice Sky bar is a treat and people came from all around to try and get up there

Rooftop bar
Breakfast
Skybar
Bedrooms
Staff everything was of very high standard. 
Can’t wait to return to this beautiful hotel.

Review Title: Excellent weekend break and exceptional value for rooms, breakfast , location and service.
Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Awesome breakfast buffet! Friendly and helpful smiley staff, very tolerant of my lack of Spanish. Metro stop right outside! Also one of very few hotels who would guarantee a twin room despite booking months in advance.

Negative Reviews: We didn't stay longer was my only problem
Positive Reviews: The staff were Brilliant, the hotel was spotless and fabulous hotel,the rooms spacious, Breakfast was awesome

Review Title: Great location and staff, modern rooms and great breakfast buffet.
Positive Reviews: We had an early morning arrival and the front desk was able to grant our request for an earlier check-in, which was great! Wonderful friendly staff. Very modern rooms. Love the security of the elevator system! Excellent breakfast buffet. If you like to walk, it is not too far to the museums. The palace is also close to the hotel.

Review Title: Excellent hotel and would definitely recommend, just open the pool a little earlier!
Negative Reviews: It advertises a rooftop pool and said it was open spring and summer (which was one of the main reasons we booked this hotel) however we were disappointed to find the pool closed as it’s only open in the summer. I would’ve thought that the middle of May and temperatures of 30 plus degrees would’ve warranted the pool being open.
Positive Reviews: Customer service was brilliant, rooms were lovely and spacious. Breakfast was one of the best hotel breakfasts  I’ve ever had-so much choice, and the rooftop bar was an absolute bonus. Loved it.

Negative Reviews: All good
Positive Reviews: Superb hotel, spacious rooms, great staff, lovely breakfast (and best rooftop bar) - overall a thoroughly enjoyable stay

Review Title: Fantastic location with comfortable room and excellent breakfast buffet
Negative Reviews: No shade in the overspill area of the pool area
Positive Reviews: Always like coming to RIU Plaza Espana. Staff friendly, accommodation comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet fantastic

Review Title: A great hotel in a great location
Positive Reviews:
Everything about our stay at Riu Plaza Espana has been lovely. 
Every staff member we have come into contact with has been both friendly and professional, and we are grateful that they are happy to speak English. 
Our 6th floor room is spacious and modern, the beds are extremely comfortable and the aircon works well. 
Breakfast options are amazing!

Review Title: beautiful hotel, great location, no personal attention to guests
Positive Reviews:
+ Beautiful hotel with awesome view from the rooftop lounge area;
+ Breakfast options;

Negative Reviews: Some of the waiters from the rooftop terrace can do with some customer service courses: taking a chair from a sitting lady to move her from the table where she was already consuming drinks bought from the bar  should never happen in any place but to see it happening there was quite a shock! ( it didn't happen to me nor to any of my friends, I just witnessed it while enjoying my drink and atmosphere and having a wonderful time on the beautiful terrace).
Positive Reviews:
All about the hotel, location and rooftop terrace - view and atmosphere - especially.
They greeted us with a bottle of fizz and some nice fruits, The room was cleaned to perfection every morning. Fabulous breakfast, tasteful coffee.

Review Title: Amazing staff, fantastic location, clean and comfortable. We will be returning
Negative Reviews: The pool is a bit small but the idea is excellent. I think having the bar the otherside with music and sun loungers would be a really good idea, you could even have a smaller splash area for younger kids to use the space a bit better
Positive Reviews: The location was fantastic and the access to the roof top bar and priority to staff was really unquestionable.

Negative Reviews: English TV channels were a challenge but that's not what we were there for!  Would have been nice to have access to a spa on site
Positive Reviews: Perfect location for exploring the city by foot, the most amazing rooftop bar and the staff go out of their way to help!

Review Title: An excelllent hotel that caters for all ages with a smile
Negative Reviews: the pool was over crowded and there were people there that weren’t staying at the hotel but had gained access with someone they had met
Positive Reviews: the facilities, the location and the helpful staff

Review Title: Amazing for groups! Central and very modern and clean.
Negative Reviews: Would be good if hotel guests could reserve space at the 360 bar
Positive Reviews: Fantastic hotel, would strongly recommend. Perfect location. Despite being such a large hotel it didn’t feel too crowded in any of the communal areas and there was usually space around the pool. Poolside bar was also great. Staff were always helpful and friendly.

Review Title: The staff are friendly and the hotel clean. BUT basic facilities are needed room & pool service
Negative Reviews:
There were no rooms with double beds absolve. 

No one speaks English apart from people on the desk. The waitress cannot and the life guard cannot et. 

There is no room service - this is unacceptable for a 4 star 

There is no pool service and every day we had to fight to get drinks there. This is unacceptable you are a 4 star hotel. You need to provide pool service 

The mini bar is empty! And I was never told I could fill it up. Again unacceptable 

They do not replace the coffee cups every morning in our rooms - they were dirty every night when I came home 

I asked for bottles of water to be delivered to my room a few times and it took 50 mins and the wrong order arrived one time
Positive Reviews: The staff were friendly and it was clean. The pool and bar was good but no drinks service at the pool which is unacceptable.

Negative Reviews: Breakfast staff could be a bit more service friendly.  Interesting elevator system could get a bit confusing.
Positive Reviews: Great location (although major construction present) Lots of local and international restaurants close by. Nice rooftop bar, full buffet breakfast.

Review Title: The hotel has a great location, but falls short in other important aspects.
Negative Reviews: Despite being situated on the 16th floor, we could still hear a significant amount of noise from the lively area surrounding the hotel through the windows, as well as noise from the corridor and other rooms nearby. There was no coffee machine in the room, instead, we found a tea maker and some instant coffee, which was unexpected for a hotel of this caliber. While the breakfast was decent, it did not meet our high expectations. For example the traditional Spanish ham (Jamón) served was below our expectations and of lower quality compared to other 4-star hotels we've visited;  When I called the reception to request a tea spoon, I was informed that there would be an additional charge if it were to be brought to the room. Lastly, the mini-bar was completely empty, offering no items.
Positive Reviews: The hotel sits in a great location, within walking distance of many tourist attractions such as the Royal Palace (Palacio Real) and the iconic Gran Via, filled with shops, theaters, and cinemas. The room was very nice and spacious, offering a lovely view of Plaza España square and a partial view of Gran Via, however, for this we had to upgrade at the reception for an additional fee. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean. We also appreciated the complimentary water bottle provided daily. Having free access to the 360 Sky Bar sitting at the top of the hotel was also a great perk of staying in Riu for the amazing views and nice atmosphere it provides.

Negative Reviews: The roof top pool is noisy of an evening which the noise filters down to the rooms if you have your window open. The restaurant was very nice but often booked up quickly.
Positive Reviews: Great location. Clean and comfortable.  Lifts are really good once you get used to them. Facilities very good.

Review Title: Amazing hotel, RIU worthy. Location & staff really nice.
Negative Reviews: Pool is a bit small and crowded, but if you visit Madrid often you know pools are quite rare so happy to have one here!
Positive Reviews: Breakfast was amazing, everything was super good quality. Been to many hotels/resorts but haven’t seen so many choices of food at a breakfast. Also loved the typical spanish options they had! Staff in the lobby was super friendly, make sure to give them a tip! When checking out you can leave your baggage in a guarded room and you can only get your baggage with your own tag on it, very safe and gives a good feeling.

Negative Reviews: The pool terrace has two sides- one poolside which understandably gets really busy and is popular. The other side can be used as an over spill or a quieter space to lounge in away from children and the noise which is great but it really could do with parasols to give people using that area shade as there is absolutely no shade.
Positive Reviews: Love coming to Riu Plaza España. Staff are really attentive. Rooms are clean and freshly re made whilst at breakfast. A lot on offer for breakfast. Rooms are cool  from the intense heat outside.

Negative Reviews: Only minor downside is the waiting times for the elevators. Otherwise we just had a fantastic stay.
Positive Reviews:
This was the second time we stayed over, everything is just perfect. 
Great breakfast, very friendly staff, nice and spacious rooms, magnificent rooftop, nearby metro station, clean, pool, wifi,...
You have a hotel guest priority lane for accessing the rooftop, which is awesome.
We will definitely advise this hotel & come back.

Negative Reviews: swimming pool is small and very packed with people
Positive Reviews: breakfast, spacious room, awesome terrace, great staff,
Room Type: Deluxe Superior King Room with Terrace

Review Title: It was a great value hotel and my family and I really enjoyed our stay here.
Negative Reviews: There could have been more seating in the lobby and the elevators got a bit chaotic during busy times.
Positive Reviews: The room was very clean and comfortable. I loved the wide selection of foods available at the breakfast. The gym had sufficient equipment for a brief workout and the employees were very great at accommodating all of our needs.

Review Title: New and clean, nice roof top bar

No decent musli or granola at breakfast- just the cheapest one
Positive Reviews: Quite new and thus quite clean, nice big bathroom, nice rooftop bar and pool with great view

Negative Reviews:

Positive Reviews: The hotel has a perfect location, right in the center, you can take a taxi, metro or walk around the center easily. The room was spacious, with free coffe, tea and water, had everything I needed for my short stay.

Negative Reviews:

Positive Reviews: Modern, clean hotel with reasonably spacious rooms. Great rooftop bar with spectacular view.

Negative Reviews: Location and roof top
Positive Reviews: The best location. buffet breakfast great too many varieties very clean and the guys in Rolf top de best waitress.

Positive Reviews: The staff opening the door for you is a great touch. Room was clean and comfortable great views.

The view from the room is also very nice, facing Plaza de Espana. The hotel has private parking which is very convenient for my family who traveled by car.

Positive Reviews: The staff was very friendly,the bed was comfortable. As we had a deluxe room,the whole room was also spacious. Breakfast had great variety.

On a side note: be aware that if you book via booking, it doesn't guarantee you bed type ( two single beds/ large king size bed) or view from the hotel room. The customer service attendant explained that they will select this based on availability and not what you select on booking, just something to keep in mind :)

Negative Reviews:
Stayed for one night and chose this hotel due to the swimming pool, very convenient with 35ºC in Summer. However, as soon as we arrived they told us that the swimming pool was only available until 3 pm (when the checkin was expected to be done at 3pm). Huge disappointment, the swimming pool was good though
Another not-very intelligent thing is that the bathroom has a strong automatic light and a glass door next to the bed. So going to the bathroom during the night implies being awaken until the night turns off. The designer who did this has no clue
Positive Reviews:
The rooftop access is great and unique in the city. The location is very convenient for tourists, especially since the Plaza de España is now open for the public
The staff and checkin/out process was very comfortable

Negative Reviews: Even though we had Internet issues we could not get a paper menu from the roof bar and the service there was ok but not more. The rest of the service in the hotel was excellent and the roof bar let the hotel down.
Positive Reviews: Great location. Great room. Great service.

Negative Reviews:
1- very strong sound come from the seiling and the hotel staff told me to stop the air conditioning if I want the sound get away!!!
      2- the unbelievable thing the doer man doesn’t help me to get taxi and he said in the corner of the street you will find the taxi stop !!! and when the taxi come he didn’t help with my luggage!!!! for what the hotel  hire such as this person? isn’t for help the guests.
Positive Reviews: Breakfast and location

Negative Reviews: We went to the rooftop bar on our last night. No queue to get in. It was busy and we sat at a table that needed to be cleaned but as the staff were busy it took 10 mins or more to clear the table. No problem with that however while it was being cleared a hostess approached us to tell us as we sat at a used table we had to go outside and now queue for a clear table.... despite the fact it was in the middle of being cleaned.
Positive Reviews: The location was great, right beside the metro and walking distance to everything. Breakfast was very good.

Negative Reviews: The rooms didn’t had enough bed sheets and they were too cold. The staff didn’t help us with the heater.
Positive Reviews: The location and the breakfast buffet.

Negative Reviews:
Have to said that I've been business traveling to madrid twice per year since 2014.
VP was always the best option before RIU reopened it on 2019.
However, this time was terrible experience that I have never had before.
You'll feel very uncomfortable spending 1000 euro for two nights, but the heat system is not working and can only provide you blanket to keep you warm in the room.
Besides, the staff at roof top bar is unwillingly to serve single traveler.
Positive Reviews:
The view is amazing at both 27th floor roof top, and 26th restaurant.
Definitely worth trying.

Negative Reviews: The doormen are rude! Due to the sky bar, they make non residents go around the back which is fine, however, they need training on how to approach people politely. I was refused access and I had a room there!! finally I showed my key and they let me in. on the other hand, front desk staff are fantastic!!
Positive Reviews: we love the location easy to walk anywhere. they offer a fabulous buffet breakfast.

Negative Reviews: The language barrier was a little difficult as the staff didn’t have great English and our Spanish is just as bad although it wasn’t too much of a problem.
Positive Reviews:
The friendly atmosphere and helpful staff. The rooftop bar was fantastic the hotel was exceptionally clean very comfortable and easy to navigate for the size. 
Breakfast buffet was amazing.

Review Title: Amazing hotel... just a few tweaks needed!
Negative Reviews: Unfortunately I couldn't order room service breakfast as the line was constantly busy and nobody called me back. The gluten free breakfast options in the restaurant were very poor and limited. I appreciate it's a big hotel but a lot of guests are GF and it was so disappointing that I couldn't eat breakfast on my lovely balcony. I also had to chase up my cocktail order in the 360 bar after 20 mins of waiting in the heat! I am sure these things will be tweaked in time because overall the hotel is very special and the staff very helpful.
Positive Reviews: My room's balcony was AMAZING! Sooooo big snd the views over Madrid were breathtaking. The room itself was spacious and nicely decorated. The 360 rooftop bar was just as incredible!

The bed was not good and in particular the pillows very bad. The best in my opinion in a hotel bed are always the pillows. In some hotels you even get a menu with different types of pillows to chose from
Also the temperature was not appropriate for winter
The hotel doesn't have business center!! I had to check some work in my PC and there was no place to privately sit and work
AND ABOVE ALL DEFFICIENT COVID MEASURES: IN THE RESTAURANTS NO DISTANCE, TOO CROWDED NONE OF THE WAITERS WEAR GLOVES

Review Title: Great location but average standard hotel.
Negative Reviews:
Towels very old not the standard youd expect in this type of hotel and for the price. Hair dryer basic. Room pretty good but basic.
Dining hall huge and like a school canteen for noise perhaps smaller sections may help but probably not as cost effective. First night we arrived was very late and no food or snacks available. Staff in sky bar first night very unattentive, we had to get up and ask for service 1 small glass of peanuts between 4 people ordering gin n tonics very stingy.
11 oclock check out.
Positive Reviews:
Location.
Variety of breakfast.
Could leave bags in hotel.
Lifts not very effective, last mirning chaos hindred of people checking out at 11 perhaps they should offer staggered check out on sunday even if they charged sure it would alleviate that chaos.
The glass balcony is a very impressive.

Negative Reviews:
I felt alone and anonymous in vast crowds being processed like numbers. 
I absolutely hated the breakfast room. It is vast and crowded and like a railway station. Why are there no trays when food is so far from tables. It bordered on frightening it was so busy and so anonymous. The staff are like dozens of oiled robots dressed in black scurrying amongst the hoards of guests. 
The corridors in this vast building are drab and dark and colourless, adding to the mechanica anonymous feel of the place. 
The bedroom was very nondescript and the whole place is brown and grey. The bed was a bit too hard. 
All the staff I interacted with were professional but not friendly. All seemed to be too busy. Customers are numbers to be processed quickly here.
I will not be back.

Food at breakfast

Negative Reviews: noise at 11-12 midnight people shouting and running up and down the corridor outside my room, single bed would of prefered a double bed.  Room service was average not very tasteful.

Review Title: The nicest, friendliest staff is at RIU España
Negative Reviews: I had two reservations. My first reservation was 2 rooms, 616 and 1118. Room 1118 was great, beautiful. My adult children got that room. My husband and I got stuck in room 616, which I think is the worst room in the hotel. The window wasn’t really a window and opened to the roof. But you couldn’t see out the window. My husband and I felt like we were in a submarine. Also, I don’t know what’s above that room but it was constantly noisy even very very early in the morning. It sounded like carts were being rolled above our heads. It was awful. I even paid for an extra night because we were getting there early June 18th but I paid for June 17th because I wanted the room right away on the 18th because we landed at 8:00 in the morning. So I feel like I was ripped off and got the worst room. However, last 2 nights we stayed in room 1028, family room, that was beautiful and awesome.

Everyone so friendly

Positive Reviews: I recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel, and I must say, it was a fantastic experience from start to finish! Every aspect of my stay was enjoyable, and I can't wait to share my positive feedback. The hotel's ambiance was inviting, and my room was clean, comfortable, and well-equipped with all the amenities I needed. What truly set this hotel apart was its exceptional staff. The team members were warm, friendly, and always ready to go the extra mile to ensure guests' satisfaction. From the reception desk to the restaurant and the concierge, every staff member seemed genuinely dedicated to making my stay memorable. They were very professional but also personable, making me feel valued as a guest, staff was incredibly attentive and proactive in accommodating my requests. Their professionalism and willingness to assist with any queries or concerns I had made a lasting impression on me.

Review Title: Great base for exploring the city. Fabulous location. Hotel has some limitations
Negative Reviews:
This hotel is massive and was packed to the rafters - over 1,000 guests - so (functional) breakfast was like a conveyor belt. Lacked any atmosphere. Food ok. Difficult to get any help from staff as they seemed very stretched - although always super polite. 
The rooftop ‘swimming pool’ is a joke. It’s a paddling pool stuffed to the gills with kids. With families cramped around. We jumped on the metro to the public open air pools in casa del campo - a necessity in 40 degree heat! They were spacious, spotlessly clean and a couple of euros for the day. There was a quieter roof top sun deck at the Riu which was virtually empty. 
The bar on the sky deck was one to avoid. Pounding music and stuffed with people. 
Will def come back to stay at Riu as a great base for Madrid

Review Title: Great hotel, dreadful location of room.
Negative Reviews:
During our stay there were two events. 
1st event was on a Saturday, a wedding reception with a live band and a DJ. When we asked at reception when it was going to finish we were told 10pm as they would be going down to the 4th floor. The music didn’t stop till 00.30 then the noise from the kitchen staff started and went on for another hour.
The 2nd event was on a Tuesday. We noticed banners going up and the door to the terrace was locked with a sign saying a private event was going to take place that evening. We went to reception and asked when this was going to finish. No one seemed to know the answer to that question. However, there was no music and was pretty quiet until it finished with people shouting whilst leaving the event. Needless to say this went on late and then the kitchen staff started the clear up until 4am. Trolleys being pushed along staff talking loudly and shouting. Chairs and tables dragged along. Doors banging. A trolley crashed into our door and that’s when I shouted at them and my wife actually got up and reminded them there were guests in the room. 
Even in the days of no events we were woken up at regular intervals throughout the night by service staff banging doors and then the morning cleaning staff talking loudly.
Be warned! NO TO ROOM 2122, in our opinion it should not be sold as guest accommodation.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is great, the bars are very nice, the staff are lovely BUT the room we were given, 2122, for our 5 nights stay was/is opposite a roof terrace and next door to the service area for the cleaners and the service kitchen for events on the 21st floor.

It was my husband's birthday on the 18th. We returned to the hotel after dining out. We went to the rooftop bar for a last drink before going to sleep. My husband speaks Spanish as do I. He asked a waitress if we could order a drink. It was 00:20hrs. She was very rude to us and said in an abrupt manner I don't know if you can, I'll ask. She went to the bar and didn't speak to anyone. She had no intention of serving us. We asked another lady if we could order a drink and she was very polite and helpful and took our order. We stayed until 01:00hrs when the bar closed and the first waitress avoided us altogether. Her attitude was very poor. She even told us that she didn't want to be here and wanted to return to Bolivia. Telling us something so personal was very unprofessional, in my opinion, especially as we only asked for a drink. 
We missed breakfast as it is very early and we didn't know if you had room service. The coffee in the room was awful.

Review Title: Politely suggest you view your room before paying for it !!! Can be good but `can`  be sub-optimal
Negative Reviews: Paid extra for room with a view which I received on a previous stay 6 days previously no problems (lovely double aspect room on 16th floor fantastic views) - however on this stay despite booking exactly the same room class  and paying exactly the same  rate as my previous booking and a booking confirmation clearly stating a room with a view, I was allocated a dingy dank room on the 6th floor with no natural light  and totally opaque glassed windows which on opening revealed a scenic vista of a brick wall and an exhaust vent flu for the kitchen - on very politely informing the hotel of the error of their ways (I am very much an English gentleman not a descamisados Britanicos) I was told by the female receptionist after doing some air typing in a `computer says no` stylee that there was nothing they could do . Having paid for my room before seeing it and it was late in the afternoon, there was not a lot I could do either except an objective posting of my room view photos on t`internet..  My exact same `issue` appears multiple times on multiple hotel review sites so this is not Ranty McRantface with  a subjective issue as to a mis-perceived verbal slight but the non provision of service objectively stated in writing.  This `issue` also when raised repeatably engenders a stock cut and paste response on review sites without ever addressing the very basic fact that this hotel has not given their customers what they have paid for and  in my case were expectantly looking  forward very much to enjoy.

This was our first time in a high tech hotel so it was quite confusing how to use the lifts at first. Your room card needs to be put against the black box outside the lifts first before it then tells you which lift you can take.  When there are lots of people this can mean you’re left waiting quite a time for a lift.
There was a smell of drains - very unfortunate in a hotel of this calibre.
Positive Reviews:
Good spread of breakfast with freshly cooked eggs to your description if you wanted.  Very slick management of people as it was the busiest weekend of the year. Vast restaurant area with staff directing you to your table very ably.
We discovered on our last day that the area in front of the hotel is very beautiful with gardens leading to the Royal Palace and it’s gardens.  Also from the gardens you can look back at the front of the hotel and see it’s iconic style.
Staff were very pleasant and friendly and questions were answered and dealt with very quickly eg I needed another blanket - it arrived very quickly.

Negative Reviews:
First of, I asked for a king size bed and for the first time in many years using Booking.com, they told me they could not honor my request and gave me 2 twins ( which I strongly refused).
The room I was in was extremely small and dark, the decor is simply depressing as well as the hallways, I though I was inside The Shining film. 
The towels instead of dry, they scratch, cheap quality. The color and texture of the rug was awful, scratchy too. The blanket was dark grey and cheapest quality in the market.
How can I understand that a 4 star hotel doesn’t have a restaurant? Unheard of.
The staff uniform go according with the room decor, even the good looking employees look ugly , they look cheap and safari like, Madrid is not the Serengeti Savannah. 
They give you only one bottle of water for your entire stay, unheard of too. Cheap, cheap, cheap.
Never again, I will stay in a Riu hotel. You might serve other type of customers but, certainly not the American customer.

Review Title: an excellent hotel for a relaxing city break
Negative Reviews: The pool wasn’t open. It was sunny and 26 degrees Celsius on average every day of our stay. I would have really liked the option to relax in the pool during my stay. The rooftop bar has amazing views but we never got the chance to sit down and have drinks in it, while the hotel say that they cater for hotel guests first this does not guarantee you a seat and there doesn’t seem to be an option for guests to reserve seats from what I noticed. it’s very busy with tourists queueing to take pictures and this is similar with the main entrance into the hotel. It didn’t bother me personally but it’s worth noting that people will hang around speaking to the door men asking questions about the rooftop bar even though there are clear signs stating they need to use a different entrance.
Positive Reviews: The property is situated in the heart of the city and is walking distance to the royal palace of Madrid, plaza de  mayor and  mercado de San Miguel. it’s a 40 minute train ride from the airport and once off the train the hotel is 80m away. The hotel itself is lovely and clean. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. They make up your room everyday and give fresh towels and water. The breakfast is exceptional and I have personally never seen such a vast selection of food. I feel like the hotel works extremely hard to cater for all its guests. I would highly recommend and the next time I travel to Madrid I will definitely stay here.

Everybody was so friendly and helpful. The cleanliness of the room, amazing! The service, amazing! The sky bar, amazing! The bar had so many people and the staff managed always to be sooo friendly and serve the guest so fast. I will come back for sure :)

Review Title: Fabulous hotel, fantastic location, awesome staff!!
Negative Reviews: We had a problem with the air conditioning in the room and whilst helpful non of the suggestions to correct it worked. They manager on the desk was unsympathetic and matter of fact - at 3am in a room at 25c I was struggling to sleep but the rest of my family were sleeping and calling reception at that time would have disturbed them and really wasn’t an option. But apart from that the hotel was fabulous and it was nice to be a tourist in Madrid for once!!
Positive Reviews: The atmosphere, the staff were exceptional, the breakfast was wonderful.

Negative Reviews:
Very disappointing stay at the hotel:
- The room had no chance to regulate temperature. The aircon was out of order. So I had to sleep in a room with 24-25 degree Celcius at any time. Staff told me that probably cooling is switched off during cold season. Window was only possible to open a crack. Due to the location of the room and with the very small window (looking to the rooms opposite), there was almost no daylight. Lamps were necessary day and night.
- The worst part of the hotel is the lousy, arrogant and unfriendly staff in the rooftop bar. We were a big group, staying for a conference in the hotel for almost a week. Bar closes at 1 am, even as dinner time in Madrid is usually very late. At 1 am straight you will be unfriendly kicked out of the bar, no matter if you are guest or whatever. I asked if this was a Country rule due to COVID or a RIU rule. The answer of the lady there was: This is a RIU rule, I completely agree with this rule and you have to comply. It is 8 min past 1, leave the bar.
- Room service at night does not exist. When kicked out of the bar there is no chance to get anything else from room service than water 

I never experienced any hotel at this level with a worse customer focus. Looks like as a customer you should be happy and thankful to get the opportunity to leave your money there. Well RIU, first and last time.
Positive Reviews: Actually the best of the hotel is the hand dryer in the washroom of the bar. Really powerful. And the ladies in the lobby bar were friendly as well.

Positive Reviews: The breakfast buffet was exceptional, the staff were friendly

Negative Reviews:
We had high expectations of this hotel given the reviews.  But unfortunately in our case these  were not met. After a grueling transatlantic flight and having undergone chemotherapy on the same day of the trip, I had asked my nephews (residents in Madrid whom I had not seen for a decade), to visit and have lunch with us at the RIU Hotel. Upon their arrival at the hotel entrance, they were treated disrespectfully by the manager, who insisted that they pay an entrance fee. How is it possible that a hotel guest is not allowed to receive visitors, especially when they come with the intention of consuming at the restaurant? Where is the consideration for a guest, having even explained to the guard that I (a hotel guest) am a cancer patient?

This experience generated deep dissatisfaction with the service provided by this hotel and its lack of empathy towards atypical or occasional difficult circumstances of its guests.

Separately the hotel’s rooftop bar, which apparently is quite famous in town, while very nice given the spectacular views, was packed full. The line of people waiting to enter was extremely long, surrounding the whole restaurant, making the experience too noisy and chaotic. The line should be outside the facility, not in there among the guests seated for dinner and aiming at enjoying a pleasurable evening.
Positive Reviews: Location, good sized room, very comfortable mattress.

Review Title: Amazing hotel, fantastic location- don't expect any service after 1pm on checkout day..
Negative Reviews:
The only thing that let's this hotel down is the way you are treated once you have checked out.
We checked out at 11am but our flight home wasn't until late evening so we had planned to visit the Sky Bar and restaurant for our last dinner in Madrid- the perfect way to end a special weekend. 
However, we were told that after 1pm we would need to pay 10 euros each to visit and that we could only access via the door at the back.
I fully appreciate that this maybe the Rui's policy, however the concierge team made us feel very unwelcome which we feel was unacceptable given that we had spent £200 a night to stay and only that morning we were considered valued guests of the hotel.
We've never been made to feel this way and have always been able to use hotel facilities after check out when we have had a later flight home. This has made us reluctant to choose a Rui again in the future and we hope this policy will be reviewed as it seems unfair.
Positive Reviews: The location is amazing and the hotel itself is beautiful with fantastic facilities.

Negative Reviews: Rude staff. if you need early checkin forget about it. They wont do anything about it. 3:00pm no exceptions. Lobby very crowded with people waiting for the room.

Negative Reviews:
I arrived this hotel after midnight, was told that the hotel was overbooked and I should be relocated to another hotel about 400m away for the first night. (I had three nights booking) It was after midnight and I was a foreigner in Spain during busy season of big international conference, therefore there were no other options but to agree with their suggestion. They offered me a free taxi ride to the relocated hotel but it was after tremendously tiring 20hrs flight and I felt really terrible. They forced me to pay before relocation. The relocated hotel, was same 4 star hotel, however much smaller room with spotted towels, room quality was never comparable. I would have never chosen that hotel unless it was late night. I could not agree with the same payment for this hotel and the relocated one, also my times consumed for relocating, packing my luggage again and coming back during a busy business trip can never be compensated with just one free drink ticket and small chocolate box I turned down. I had a very hard time managing the situation and was deeply disappointed their worst management and apologies. i asked my first night should be refunded through booking.com service center, which was rejected by the hotel. 
I agree the room condition and breakfast of the hotel was good, and that's why I got more offended after coming back to this hotel as the facility of the rolocated first night was much poorer. The best hotel is not only about facilities. If you choose this hotel, please make sure that it is not overbooked, or you will have the most terrible experience in your life.

Review Title: Room next to a construction site
Negative Reviews:
Avoid.

We paid a premium price for a room with a terrace. Little did we know that our room was right next door to extremely loud construction work (electric drilling g, hammering, etc) which woke us up on two occasions. The hotel staff tried to compensate with a €20 bottle of wine (we're not drinkers) and have since ignored all our requests for some legitimate form of a refund. Ridiculous considering we paid €650+ for our stay and couldn't enjoy our room.

The hotel itself is too big to provide an adequate service to all guests, while running tourist experiences and various conferences and events. 

Will choose a boutique hotel next time.

Review Title: Good... if you have a room with a view
Negative Reviews:
If you don't secure a room with a view, they will give you an "internal view" room, which is essentially no view at all. Even worse, you could get in a low floor room with shaded and locked windows, making you feel like you are sleeping in a bathroom. I had to complain in order to get a room with a view, which fortunately I was able to get at no extra cost.

Having the right information at the time of booking would have affected my decision, as "internal view" rooms are unacceptable.

Also, the hotel was packed, and the breakfast room was too crowded.

Review Title: Unfriendly staff and broken elevators … never again.
Negative Reviews:
As we arrived we had extremely annoying discusssins about our room-reservation. They didn’t want to give us our confirmed room. The hotel managers alleged that BOOKING.COM had made a mistake. BOOKING.COM promised us a room, but the hotel no longer has it available. They said they didn't send a confirmation, it was BOOKING.COM. They  could only give us the selected room class for 1 day, but no longer. The whole discussion lasted about half an hour. I said that I would like to speak to BOOKING.COM to get a room in another hotel like Hyatt or similar because RIU Espana suddenly no longer wanted to accept the booking. Only then did the Hotel-Magament give in. And suddenly got the booked room for this entire week. It was all very annoying. My vacation started terribly. It was outrageous what they allowed themselves.

The elevators were constantly disrupted. In addition, the card keys failed several times.

we were 3 guest so I booked a room for 4 people then a i realized that i putted the wrong dates so i cancelled mi booking and make the same reservation with the right dates in the same room. But in that moment i putted 2 guest instead of 3. I did not worry to much because in booking said that the price for 2/3/4 guest is the same and that room had capacity for 4. By the way i text a message to the hotel throught the booking app. Using the chat of my reservation. They did not respond.  I make a phone call and they no respond.

the problem was when i came to the hotel. i have to pay 125 euros (extra) because we were 3!!!! in a room of 4!!!
And i told the recepcionist that i booked for 3 and they i changed the booking(i told the situacion) And also insaid to her that the price in booking was the same for 2/3 or 4 they did not said nothing about paying and extra for a room. Even when the room is for 4 and we were 3!.

A really disaster. i felt cheated. i payed that! . And if booking can do something for me i will always use this app. But if not i guess i will never use this again. because this experience ruined my trip and cost me a lot of extra money that also make no sense

Review Title: Beautiful hotel spoiled by the crowds on the rooftop bar
Negative Reviews: One of the reasons I booked this hotel was because of the rooftop bar, however this is also the reason I would not return.  Don't get me wrong it is amazing however, each time we entered the hotel I felt like I had to prove I was a guest as the doorman asks people entering that are not guests and who wish to go to the rooftop bar to leave and go around the back of the hotel, to enter via a different lift. They are also charged to enter.  The result of this is not a pleasant experience, this makes it difficult to obtain a seat (and it wasn't even high season) and as you don't actually need to be there for any food or drink there are queues that wrap around the area for photo opportunities on the glass platform or even just wandering around looking at the views this makes you feel you are sitting in the middle of a tourist attraction. Not what I pay to go to a nice hotel to experience.
